trial_identification.studytitle: Early ureteric stent removal reduces urinary tract infection in kidney transplant recipients, A Randomized Controlled Trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Early ureteric stent removal reduces urinary tract infection in kidney transplant recipients, A Randomized Controlled Trial

primaryOutcome.outcome: % of Urinary tract infection defined as white blood cell(WBC)>5 /high power field(HPF) in urinary analysis plus bacteriuria in urine culture

secondaryOutcome.outcome: % of Urologic complication defined as urinary obstruction or urinary leakage that diagnosis with clinical suspicious plus ultrasonography or renal scan
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Post operative until 1 week after hospital discharge

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Length of stay (days) by use medical records

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Adult patients who undergo for kidney transplant (both living related and cadaveric)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: 1. Patient who has history of reflux nephropathy or neurogenic lower urinary tract disease 2. Abnormal structure of kidney donor 3. Cold ischemic time > 36 hours 4. Patient who has abnormal urinary tract 5. En bloc kidney from pediatric donor 6. Patient who has difficult intraoperative technique (eg. Small caliber ureter) that defined by urologist 7. Patient who receive antibiotic other than standard regiemen 8. Patient who denied for inform and consent

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using computer generated block randomization

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 4th Floor, The Royal Golden Jubilee Bldg., 2 Soi Soonvijai, New Petchburi Road, Bangkapi, Huaykwang, Bangkok 10310, Thailand.

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 4th Floor, The Royal Golden Jubilee Bldg., 2 Soi Soonvijai, New Petchburi Road, Bangkapi, Huaykwang, Bangkok 10310, Thailand.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: To determine the potential benefit and harmful of early ureteric stent removal (7 days) compare with routine ureteric stent removal (14 days) in kidney transplant recipient.

ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: Faculty of Medicine Ramathibodi Hospital, Mahidol University, Rama 6, Ratchathewi, Bangkok, 10400, Thailand
